item.title: GCSEs and A-level exams in 2022 will be graded more generously
item.description: But grade inflation caused by two years of teacher-assessed grades will not continue, exam boards say.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: World leaders step up talks amid invasion fears
item.description: Talks begin in Moscow between the French and Russian leaders amid fears Russia could invade Ukraine.

item.title: Paralysed man with severed spine walks thanks to implant
item.description: World first using electrical implant developed by a team of Swiss researchers

item.title: Boris Johnson sang 'I Will Survive' to new communications chief Guto Harri
item.description: The PM's new director of communications Guto Harri reveals how he accepted the new job in Downing Street.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Team GB curlers to play for bronze after semi-final loss to Norway
item.description: Great Britain's curling mixed doubles pair miss the chance to guarantee at least a silver medal at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Covid: Tough new targets will tackle NHS backlog, Boris Johnson says
item.description: Boris Johnson promises action after plans to tackle record waiting lists in England are delayed.

item.title: Asda in cheap food promise after Jack Monroe complaints
item.description: The supermarket vows to stock its budget range in all stores after the food activist criticised shortages.

item.title: World Cup 2030: UK & Republic of Ireland FAs abandon 2030 bid to focus on Euro 2028
item.description: The UK and Republic of Ireland football associations agree not to bid for the 2030 World Cup and will instead focus on a joint bid to host Euro 2028.

item.title: Matthew Selby admits killing sister at Towyn caravan park
item.description: "Loving daughter and granddaughter" Amanda Selby, 15, was killed by her brother in July.

item.title: Platinum Jubilee: Gun salutes mark 70 years on the throne for the Queen
item.description: The traditional military mark of honour held to celebrate the Queen's 70 years on the throne.

item.title: Mason Greenwood: Man Utd footballer dropped by Nike after rape allegation
item.description: Manchester United footballer Mason Greenwood was arrested on suspicion of rape and sexual assault.

item.title: China's Tencent restores Fight Club ending after backlash
item.description: In a rare reversal, Chinese streaming giant Tencent undid massive cuts it had made to the original.

item.title: Fatherhood joy for paralysis implant dad
item.description: David Mâ€™zee received an electrical implant to his spine in 2017, it enables him to walk slowly and stand.

item.title: Gosport rescue: Barking dog alerts owner to man in sea
item.description: The dog walker called 999 after her cockapoo, Poppy, kept barking and alerted her to a man in the water.

item.title: Doc Martin village 'at flooding risk' from crumbling harbour
item.description: Port Isaac's fishing fleet has depleted in recent years, leaving little money for harbour maintenance.

item.title: Cyclone Batsirai: Whole villages swept away in Madagascar
item.description: At least 10 people have been killed and nearly 50,000 displaced after Cyclone Batsirai tore through Madagascar.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: 'Itâ€™s like they stuck a knife in our back'
item.description: Ukraine has been living with war for the past eight years, and people in Dnipro are dealing with past scars and the threat of more to come.

item.title: Rudimental: Leon Locksmith Rolle writes book of tips for teens
item.description: Rudimental's Locksmith tours the youth club he credits with keeping him safe as he tries to give teens a helping hand with a new book.

item.title: Kush: Sierra Leone's new illegal drug
item.description: With Kush use spreading rapidly, local film-maker Tyson Conteh asks whether Sierra Leone can stop the march of this dangerously addictive high.

item.title: This Is Going To Hurt: Ben Whishaw on a best seller, Bond and a Bear
item.description: The actor talks about roles including playing a doctor in Adam Kay TV series This is Going to Hurt.

item.title: Tonga: How an Internet blackout left many desperate for money
item.description: The breakdown cut off a vital source of funds to Tongans at a time when they needed it most.

item.title: 'Why I loved Lata Mangeshkar as much as The Beatles'
item.description: For many South Asians around the world, Bollywood singer Lata Mangeshkar's legacy goes beyond singing.

item.title: The airport tech helping to prevent delayed flights
item.description: Surveillance software and face ID systems can speed up airports, but at what cost?

item.title: Eileen Gu: US-China tension is trickiest slope for Olympic free skier
item.description: The US-born athlete representing China is provoking as much talk about her politics as her prodigious skiing.

item.title: Camilla: The making of the future Queen Consort
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall's endorsement by the Queen is well-deserved, say royal commentators.

item.title: When did young Elizabeth realise that one day she would become Queen?
item.description: As the Queen marks 70 years on the throne, historian Robert Lacey asks how prepared she was for her destiny.

item.title: Collingwood named interim England men's coach for West Indies tour
item.description: Paul Collingwood is appointed as England interim head coach for the three-match Test series against the West Indies in March.

item.title: Fancy forwards, Tuilagi trauma and Scottish resilience - Six Nations talking points
item.description: Five talking points from the opening round of the 2022 Six Nations.

item.title: Winter Olympics: GB's Dodds & Mouat to play for bronze after semi-final defeat
item.description: Great Britain's mixed doubles curling pair Jen Dodds and Bruce Mouat miss the chance to guarantee at least a silver medal, losing 6-5 to Norway in a tense semi-final.

item.title: Africa Cup of Nations: Senegal win first Afcon title as Sadio Mane hits decisive penalty
item.description: Watch highlights as Sadio Mane nets the winning spot-kick as Senegal beat Egypt 4-2 on penalties to clinch their first-ever Africa Cup of Nations after a 0-0 draw.

item.title: FA Cup: Watch the best goals from the FA Cup fourth round
item.description: Watch six of the best goals from all the FA Cup fourth-round ties, including strikes from Harry Kane, Michael Olise and Stuart Armstrong.

item.title: Chelsea pay damages to former youth players after racism claims
item.description: Chelsea agree to pay damages to eight former youth team players who alleged they were racially abused at the club in the 1990s.

item.title: Winter Olympics schedule: Day-by-day guide to key events and British medal hopes
item.description: Check out our comprehensive guide to all the key events and British medal hopes in the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Record breaking, big crashes & landing on one ski - day three best bits
item.description: Watch some of the best moments from day three of the Winter Olympics in Beijing, including outrageous skills, huge crashes and a record-breaking figure skater.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Kamila Valieva lands historic quadruple jump
item.description: Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva becomes the first woman to land a quadruple jump at an Olympic Games.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Max Parrot wins snowboard slopestyle gold three years after cancer diagnosis
item.description: Canada's Max Parrot wins Olympic snowboard slopestyle gold with the "best run of his life" - three years after being diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: Winter Olympics: medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

item.title: Beijing 2022: Life inside the Winter Olympics bubble
item.description: From robot chefs to daily testing - this is what life is like inside the Winter Games bubbles.

item.title: The Olympic curling stones crafted in Scotland
item.description: All the curling stones used in Beijing are made in Ayrshire using granite from an uninhabited island.

item.title: Winter Olympics: What is China's Covid policy and does it work?
item.description: As the Winter Olympics get underway, China is sticking to its policy of suppressing all cases.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Will the Beijing Games be 'green and clean'?
item.description: China is promising a greener Winter Olympics, although critics are not sure if it can deliver.

item.title: Winter Olympics: Why is luge the 'fastest sport on ice'?
item.description: Athletes whizz down a mile-long track of ice on a small sled in both sports - but what makes luge faster than skeleton?

item.title: Winter Olympics: All you need to know about Beijing 2022
item.description: BBC Sport tells you all you need to know about the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics.

item.title: Beijing Winter Olympics boycott: Why are the Games so controversial?
item.description: Winter Olympics host China is being criticised over its human rights record.

item.title: Winter Olympics quiz: Test your knowledge of the Games
item.description: Test your knowledge of the Winter Olympics as we build up to the 2022 Beijing Games, which run from 4-20 February.

item.title: Covid: How will my exams be different this year?
item.description: What changes are being made to give pupils a fair chance after two years of disruption due to Covid?

item.title: What are the latest rules for face coverings and masks?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but are still recommended in some settings.

item.title: What Covid tests do I still need to travel abroad?
item.description: Fully vaccinated people travelling to the UK soon won't need to take Covid tests on or before arrival.

item.title: How do I book my Covid jab and does it work against Omicron?
item.description: The government has scrapped plans to make Covid jabs mandatory for frontline NHS staff in England.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the Covid rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Covid rules are being eased across all four nations of the UK.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.
